intro: Polygala cinerea, commonly known as the pale milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and dunes. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which includes around 1,500 species of flowering plants. Polygala cinerea is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
